meanings.definition: Capable of being easily set on fire.
meanings.sent1: The dry leaves showed their inflammableness when exposed to a spark.
meanings.sent2: The old barn's wood had a high level of inflammableness.
meanings.sent3: The campfire roared to life, showcasing the inflammableness of the wood.
meanings.sent4: Her temper was like the inflammableness of gasoline, quick to ignite.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter emphasized the importance of understanding the inflammableness of different materials.

meanings.definition: The quality of being easily ignited.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the inflammableness of various substances in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter's training included recognizing the inflammableness of different materials.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about his own inflammableness around spicy food.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was like the inflammableness of a powder keg.
meanings.sent5: The warning label highlighted the inflammableness of the chemical product.
